thread.title: Shami Chakrabarti squirms after claiming Jeremy Corbyn should call for a general election
thread.title_full: Shami Chakrabarti squirms after claiming Jeremy Corbyn should call for a general election

title: Shami Chakrabarti squirms after claiming Jeremy Corbyn should call for a general election
text: At the moment Theresa May is the acceptable face of a very uncertain Brexit Shami Chakrabarti But presenter Cathy Newman slammed the Baroness’ comments, stating Mr Corbyn would be heavily defeated. Ms Newman said: “So you’re saying ‘bring it on’ for the general election but the figures show… if there was a general election tomorrow, Theresa May would win a three figure majority. As things stand at the moment you’re heading for a crashing defeat.” Baroness Chakrabarti had earlier been asked whether she thought Mr Corbyn had “as long as it takes” to turn his performance as party leader around. The Baroness referred to the large number of Labour party members and reiterated the Prime Minister had no plan on Brexit and for the future. She said: “ Jeremy Corbyn has won two massive mandates in the most numerous political party in this country, possibly in Western Europe. “At the moment Theresa May is the acceptable face of a very uncertain Brexit and Paul Nuttall is the unacceptable face. All the pictures from Copeland by-election Fri, February 24, 2017
